description: From French cautère, Latin cauterium, from Ancient Greek καυτήρ (kautḗr), variant of καυστήρ (kaustḗr, “cauterizing apparatus”), from καίω (kaíō, “burn”)). Compare caustic, cautery.

entries.meaning: A hot iron for searing or cauterizing.
examples: The punctuall, or pointed cauter; is almost square, and altogether Sharpe pointed
